body.name: Escaping Budapest: A WW2 Historical Novel Based on a True Story

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #18,148 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #1 in History of Austria & Hungary #4 in Jewish Biographies & Memoirs #40 in Historical European Biographies (Books)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I like reading any historical novel especially about WWII . I hadn’t read about the war in Hungary and Budapest. It appears they were just as brutal as the Germans . Like it was killing season on humans. It just always makes me wonder how humans can treat others in such ways. If you like WWII historical novels I would recommend this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Emotional history lesson
reviews.reviewText: "Escaping Budapest" is not just a historical account; it's a tribute to the indomitable human will to survive against all odds. It highlights the sacrifices made by individuals and families during times of war and the enduring hope that sustains them. This gripping tale, based on true events, is a stark reminder of the capacity for both good and evil that resides within us all. As I read this novel, I was reminded of the importance of bearing witness to the stories of those who lived through such tumultuous times. "Escaping Budapest" is a powerful and evocative narrative that left a lasting impact on me, prompting reflection on the resilience of the human spirit and the enduring need for compassion in our world. What truly sets this novel apart is its exploration of the complexities of human kindness and cruelty. Amidst the darkness, there are glimpses of compassion, like the Christian neighbor's initial act of kindness that saves lives. However, this kindness is contrasted with the sadistic cruelty of those who see a warped vision of purity in Hungary.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I usually don’t like writing that jumps from one character to another and time being a hindrance. but I enjoyed this book
reviews.reviewText: Character development was great actually letting you feel the starvation and cold and intense misery. The jumping between time and place told more of the feelings as it was a time that was jumbled up. No one could be certain of anything. Most of this family stayed alive through cunning,fight, observation of surroundings. Also love from a total stranger helped a bunch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Travel back in time to the harrowing days of World War II
reviews.reviewText: This novel promises a riveting narrative inspired by real events, where the shadows of war loom large, and the human spirit's resilience shines. HaLevy's storytelling transports you to a time of danger and uncertainty, following the characters' quest for freedom. If you're a fan of historical fiction that brings true stories to life and highlights the indomitable human will, this book is a must-read. Get ready for an unforgettable journey as you witness the courage and determination of those who sought to escape the turmoil of wartime Budapest.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was such a hard read, but I couldn’t put it down. The survival spirit and smart thinking of all the are absolutely amazing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Window Into the Past
reviews.reviewText: Another look into a horrendous part of WWII. Knowing that much of the novel was based on real stories and people made this book even more compelling. As a translated novel, the flow was a bit difficult to follow in places, but it was still very memorable

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is a very real and raw account of the Hugarian holocaust that is taken from real events of the authors family. The other parts of fiction but based on trueful events. I highly recommend this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A beautifully recounted story that leaves you pondering human nature and provides some basis for understanding the geopolitical quagmire that followed WW 2. I hope Posner is working on a sequel

Such despicable times! Hard to imagine how horrible one human being can be to another......and how someone can survive. War is a terrible thing, and yet, it keeps happening. Mostly political and often over religion. Do we not learn anything from our past? What makes some people feel they are superior to others? Power, perhaps?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: What a heart breaking story the Hungarians had it very tough it was incredible how anyone survived i was constantly in tears reading it
